comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] It is the PROMOTE. I should have looked in Andrews 'Ferries' book, where she is featured on p.89 with a funnel with an "N" on it - not apparent in this photo. "This small ferry managed to retain her open top deck for most of her forty years on the port. PROMOTE was built around 1930 as the NAMBUCCA and was able to carry an amazing 197 passengers on a hull only 15m long! She was sold and went to the Pittwater area in 1973 and was transferred to Lake Macquarie for conversion as a cruise boat in the late 1970s" There look to be about 197 passengers on board in this wonderful photo - all of them having a whale of a time.
